story.text: LOS ANGELES (Hollywood Reporter) - Top-ranked syndicated game shows "Wheel of Fortune" and "Jeopardy!" have been renewed for two more years each through the 2011-12 season. Among the stations extending their deals with syndicator CBS Television Distribution are ABC-owned WABC New York, KABC Los Angeles, and WLS Chicago. "Wheel," the No. 1 show in syndication, averaged an 8.3 household rating through December 17, while "Jeopardy!" was No. 3 with a 6.5 average. "Wheel" is in its 24th season, "Jeopardy!" in its 23rd. In other syndication news, Sony Pictures Television said its court show "Judge David Young" has been cleared in stations covering 75% of the United States for its fall 2007 launch. Young, a circuit court judge in Miami-Dade County who gave jail time to two drunken America West pilots, will continue in his current position until stepping down to host the show. Reuters/Hollywood Reporter
story.title: jeopardy ! and wheel set through 2012
